go somebody’s way.translation[0].definit: if an event goes your way, it happens in the way you want
everything/nothing goes somebody’s way (=used to talk about events in general)
The government are hopeful that the vote will go their way.
to continue a journey, or to leave and do what you want to do next
She said goodbye and went her way.
to travel in the same direction as someone
I can take you – I’m going your way.
